page.title: 01Quainton Buckinghamshire
page.content: Quainton is a small village about 7 miles distance from Alesbury.It is surrounded by farmland.At the top of Quainton lie Quainton hills.On one of the hills is a water-tower.In the centre of Quainton is the village Green.Every Guy Fawkes night the villagers light a bonfire on the Green.Around the Green are the post office,the butchers and a pub.There is an old pump at the top of Station Road.Along Church Street stand the Alms houses,a shop,the old rectory and the church.The main road is called Lower Street.A disused windmill stands at the foot of the hills.Some of the hills are called Quainton hill,Grange hill,Simber hill and Mill hill.
